data.message:
https://itunes.apple.com/us/book/id1090875382

Written by the Middle Eastern, Lebanese Patrick Elia Abi Khalil on the modern-world global conflicts that have led to the emergence of terrorism in the Middle East, represented by Al-Qaida, its affiliates, the ISIS, and the likes, the book takes us through the key historical events that impacted the phenomenon’s progressive development, spread, and repercussions, through an account of its reasons, fuels, motives, goals, implications, and horizons, in order to shed light on the current painful events, amidst this globalized terrorism and besieged West, to deduct ways to face and eliminate terrorism
